item.title: Violence Sweeps Coastal Syria, Sowing Chaos: ‘We Have to Get Out of Here’
item.description: Residents described shootings outside their homes and bodies in the streets in Syria’s worst unrest since Bashar al-Assad’s ouster. More than 1,000 pe...

item.title: Canada’s Liberal Party To Elect New Leader and Prime Minister to Replace Trudeau: What to Know
item.description: Front-runner Mark Carney and underdog Chrystia Freeland, both established, centrist policymakers, are vying to succeed Justin Trudeau amid grave threa...

item.title: Plan to Return Russian Diplomats to U.S. Poses Espionage Risk
item.description: The Trump administration is negotiating the return of more Russian diplomats to the United States. Some are likely to be spies.

item.title: Russia Pushes Back Ukraine’s Offensive With Drones and North Korean Troops
item.description: Russia has retaken about two-thirds of the territory Ukraine seized last summer in the Kursk region of Russia, but at a fearful cost in lives.

item.title: Hundreds of Civilians Killed by Government Forces in Syria, War Monitors Say
item.description: More than 1,000 people have been killed in fighting between forces of the new government and remnants of the ousted regime, according to a war monitor...
